American Council on Education
Washington 6, D. C.
Summary of Important Actions Taken by the Executive Committee
at the Meeting on October 4, 1961, Washington, D, c.»
The Executive Committee of the American Council on Education
met on October 4, 1961 at the Mayflower Hotel, Washington, D. C ,
beginning at 9:30 a,m. '
Present were: C. Clement French; Edmund J. Gleazer, Jr., Secretary;
David D. Henry, Chairman; Thomas H. Hamilton; 0.
Meredith Wilson; Gaylord Harnwell; Logan Wilson,
ex officio.
Guests: Margaret Habein, First Vice Chairman
Arthur G. Coons, Second Vice Chairman
Absent: 0. C. Aderhold
It was VOTED to adopt a resolution to effectuate the gift
of real estate to the Meridian House Foundation. Meridian House
was purchased by the Council, with a grant of $500,000 from the
Ford Foundation, for use as headquarters of the Washington In¬
ternational Center and several related agencies. As of July 1,
1961, the State Department contract for support of the operation
of the Washington International Center was transferred from the
Council to the Meridian House Foundation. At the same time the
Council's Advisory Committee on Policy of the Washington Inter¬
national Center was disbanded.
Financial Matters
Recommendations of change in Council's dues structure.
The Executive Committee had discussed (at a special informal
meeting in Chicago on August 31 Q-nd September 1) the necessity
for increasing dues' income. Consideration was given to further
information which was called for by the committee. (l) It was
noted that an increase is long overdue. Dues have not been
raised for more than ten years. (2) The revised structure
is needed not only to increase income but to effect more equity
"* In this summary, reports of important actions are given without
complete details; actions on routine matters have been omitted.
Authorized representatives of Council members may secure copies
of the complete minutes by addressing requests to the President
of the Council.
